The client’s objectives can be summarized in the following categories:  business, human resources and benefits objectives.  The collection of this data can be captured through multiple channels such as the review of the client’s annual report, listening to the earnings calls with investors or keeping up with articles on their business.  Armed with this information, key client contacts can articulate how the client’s business objectives impact the way they manage, grow/shrink, modify and/or support their workforce and what role the benefits program plays.

 

As the conversation takes place with the key client contact, try to focus on understanding completely the client’s objectives without introducing solutions into the discussion.  Strategic Opportunities (Solutions) can be introduced at the point that there is full understanding of what the client is trying to achieve and how Anthem can meet their needs.  Also, if the client has a consultant advisor, be sure to include the consultant’s perspective and priorities with regard to this client. Identify any gaps in the client team’s understanding of these objectives, also how the client will measure success in achieving the objectives and set action steps to address these gaps.  It is important that we understand what our clients are trying to achieve, in their own words, and that the focus of any solutions are on helping the client achieve those objectives.  This is the hardest part of the process, but when done right will be critical to the success of our partnership with the client.

 

Identifying the objectives is the first step to your Account Plan journey.Please begin with indicating below the top 5 client objectives based on your knowledge of the client and/or the client’s website.
